getPrice(address).details: Reverts if the price has not been recently updated (implementation defined).

params.asset: The asset of which to fetch the price.

getPriceNoOlderThan(address,uint256).details: This function is a sanity-checked version of `getPriceUnsafe` which is useful in applications that require a sufficiently-recent price. Reverts if the price wasn't updated sufficiently recently.

getPriceUnsafe(address).details: This function returns the most recent price update in this contract without any recency checks. This function is unsafe as the returned price update may be arbitrarily far in the past. Users of this function should check the `publishTime` to ensure that the returned price is sufficiently recent for their application. If you are considering using this function, it may be safer / easier to use either `getPrice` or `getPriceNoOlderThan`.

getPriceNoOlderThan(address,uint256).notice: Returns the price that is no older than `age` seconds of the current time.

getPriceUnsafe(address).notice: Returns the price without any sanity checks.

priceAvailable(address).notice: Returns whether a price is available or not.

documentation.text: @notice error thrown when the price is only deriveable from spotOracle

@notice Emitted when the spot oracle is set.
 @param spotOracle The new address of the spot oracle.

@notice Emitted when the pyth oracle is set.
 @param pythOracle The new address of the pyth oracle.

@title Root price oracle interface
 @dev Extends IPriceOracle
